intro: Chrysopteris dulcis, commonly known as sweet goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and aromatic leaves. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
